form.longName: PhenX PX520101 - Acute Subjective Resp To Substcurrentspecificdrugs
form.preferredDefinition: The Addiction Research Center Inventory (ARCI) is a subjective drug effects questionnaire to evaluate whether a respondent is currently affected by or under the influence of a psychologically active drug. The self-reported questionnaire was developed in the early 1960s at the National Institute of Mental Health Addiction Research Center from the use of sentence completion and other association techniques on male subjects under drug and placebo conditions. The full form of ARCI contains 550 true-false items to delineate schizoid and psychopathic characteristics, and shortened versions are widely used for both males and females.

module.longName: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - Specific - Drugs
module.preferredDefinition: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - Specific - Drugs

question.questionText: 1. I feel as if I would be more popular with people right now. (more_popular_with_people_amphetamine)
2. I feel a very pleasant emptiness. (pleasant_emptiness_amphetamine)
3. My thoughts come more easily than usual. (thoughts_come_more_easily_amphetamine)
4. I feel less discouraged than usual. (feel_less_discouraged_amphetamine)
5. I feel more excited than dreamy. (more_excited_than_dreamy_amphetamine)
6. Answering these questions is very easy right now. (answering_questions_is_easy_amphetamine)
7. My memory seems sharper to me than usual. (my_memory_seems_sharper_amphetamine)
8. I feel as if I could write for hours. (write_for_hours_amphetamine)
9. I feel very patient. (feel_very_patient_amphetamine)
10. Some parts of my body are tingling. (body_parts_tingling_amphetamine)
11. I have a weird feeling. (weird_feeling_amphetamine)
MorphineBenzedrine Scale: (morphine_scale)
12. I feel as though I say things in the easiest possible way right now. (say_things_easiest_morphine)
13. Things around me seem more pleasing than usual. (things_seem_more_pleasing_morphine)
14. I have a pleasant feeling in my stomach. (pleasant_feeling_in_stomach_morphine)
15. I fear I will lose the contentment that I have now. (fear_lose_contentment_morphine)
16. I feel in complete harmony with the world and those around me. (feel_in_complete_harmony_morphine)
17. I can completely appreciate what others are saying when I am in this mood. (appreciate_what_others_say_morphine)
18. I would be happy all the time if I felt as good as I feel now. (happy_all_the_time_morphine)
19. I feel so good that I know other people can tell it. (other_people_can_tell_morphine)
20. I feel as if something pleasant had just happened to me. (feel_something_pleasant_happened_morphine)
21. I would be happy all the time if I felt as I do now. (happy_all_the_time2_morphine)
22. I feel more clear headed than dreamy. (more_clear_headed_than_dreamy_morphine)
23. I feel as if I would be more popular with people right now. (more_popular_with_people_morphine)
24. I am in the mood to talk about the feelings I have. (talk_about_feelings_morphine)
25. I feel a very pleasant emptiness. (pleasant_emptiness_morphine)
26. My thoughts come more easily than usual. (thoughts_come_more_easily_morphine)
27. I feel less discouraged than usual. (less_discouraged_morphine)
Lysergic Acid Diethylamide (LSD) Scale: (lsd_scale)
28. I feel drowsy. (feel_drowsy_lsd)
29. I would be happy all the time if I felt as I do now. (happy_all_the_time_lsd)
30. I feel very patient. (feel_very_patient_lsd)
31. Some parts of my body are tingling. (body_parts_tingling_lsd)
32. I have a weird feeling. (weird_feeling_lsd)
33. It seems I am spending longer than I should on each of these questions. (spending_longer_on_questions_lsd)
34. My hands feel clumsy. (my_hands_feel_clumsy_lsd)
35. I notice my hand shakes when I write. (my_hand_shakes_lsd)
36. I have a disturbance in my stomach. (stomach_disturbance_lsd)
37. I have an increasing awareness of my bodily sensations. (awareness_of_bodily_sensations_lsd)
38. I feel anxious and upset. (anxious_and_upset_lsd)
39. I have an unusual weakness in my muscles. (unusual_muscle_weakness_lsd)
40. A thrill has gone through me one or more times since I started this test. (thrill_gone_through_me_lsd)
41. My movements are free, relaxed, and pleasurable. (movements_free_relaxed_pleasurable_lsd)
Benzedrine Scale: (benz_scale)
42. People might say I am a little dull right now. (little_dull_right_now_benzedrine)
43. I feel more clear headed than dreamy. (more_clear_headed_benzedrine)
44. My thoughts come more easily than usual. (thoughts_come_more_easily_benzedrine)
45. I am in the mood to talk about the feelings I have. (talk_about_feelings_benzedrine)
46. Answering these questions is very easy right now. (answering_questions_is_easy_benzedrine)
47. My memory seems sharper to me than usual. (memory_seems_sharpe_benzedrine)
48. I feel as if I could write for hours. (write_for_hours_benzedrine)
49. Some parts of my body are tingling. (body_parts_tingling_benzedrine)
50. My movements seem faster than usual. (movements_faster_than_usual_benzedrine)
51. I have better control over myself than usual. (better_control_over_myself_benzedrine)
52. My movements seem slower than usual. (movements_seem_slower_benzedrine)
53. I find it hard to keep my mind on a task or job. (hard_to_keep_mind_benzedrine)
54. I don't feel like reading anything right now. (dont_feel_like_reading_benzedrine)
PentobarbitalChlorpromazineAlcohol Scale: (pentobarbital_scale)
55. My speech is slurred. (my_speech_is_slurred_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
56. I am not as active as usual. (not_as_active_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
57. I have a feeling of just dragging along rather than coasting. (dragging_along_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
58. I feel sluggish. (i_feel_sluggish_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
59. My head feels heavy. (my_head_feels_heavy_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
60. I feel like avoiding people although I usually do not feel this way. (feel_like_avoiding_people_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
61. I feel dizzy. (i_feel_dizzy_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
62. It seems harder than usual to move around. (harder_move_around_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
63. I am moody. (i_am_moody_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
64. People might say I am a little dull right now. (dull_right_now_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
65. I feel drowsy. (i_feel_drowsy_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
66. I am full of energy. (full_of_energy_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
67. I feel more clear headed than dreamy. (more_clear_headed_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
68. I feel more excited than dreamy. (more_excited_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
69. A thrill has gone through me one or more times since I started this test. (thrill_gone_through_me_pentobarbitalchlorpromazinealcohol)
Marijuana Scale: (marijuana_scale)
70. Things around me seem more pleasing than usual. (more_pleasing_than_usual_marijuana)
71. I feel as if something pleasant had just happened to me. (something_pleasant_happened_marijuana)
72. I have difficulty in remembering. (difficulty_remembering_marijuana)
73. I feel a very pleasant emptiness. (pleasant_emptiness_marijuana)
74. My mouth seems very dry. (mouth_seems_dry_marijuana)
75. Some parts of my body are tingling. (body_parts_tingling_marijuana)
76. I have a weird feeling. (weird_feeling_marijuana)
77. My movements seem slower than usual. (movements_seem_slower_marijuana)
78. I notice that my heart is beating faster. (heart_beating_faster_marijuana)
79. My thoughts seem to come and go. (thoughts_come_and_go_marijuana)
80. I notice my hands are shaking. (hands_are_shaking_marijuana)
81. I have an increasing awareness of my bodily sensations. (increasing_awareness_of_sensations_marijuana)

Scoring Procedures and Interpretation The Addiction Research Center Inventory (ARCI) answer sheet is in truefalse format. In scoring all scales, one point is given for each response, which agrees with the scoring direction (Haertzen, 1974a). One point is given for each true response in items 121, 2327, 3140, 4351, 5565, and 7081. One point is given for each false response in the reversescored items 22, 2830, 41, 42, 5254, and 6669. The final score for each scale is the sum of the total true and reversescored false responses (scoring_520101)

protocol.longName: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - Specific - Drugs
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Addiction Research Center Inventory (ARCI) is a subjective drug effects questionnaire to evaluate whether a respondent is currently affected by or under the influence of a psychologically active drug. The self-reported questionnaire was developed in the early 1960s at the National Institute of Mental Health Addiction Research Center from the use of sentence completion and other association techniques on male subjects under drug and placebo conditions. The full form of ARCI contains 550 true-false items to delineate schizoid and psychopathic characteristics, and shortened versions are widely used for both males and females.

form.longName: PhenX PX520103 - Acute Subjective Response To Substances Current Gene
form.preferredDefinition: The Drug Effects Questionnaire (DEQ) consists of simple, face-valid, visual analog scale (VAS) questions on which people report their subjective states after ingesting a substance. The analog scale of responses ranges from "not at all" to "extremely."

headerInstruction.text: You will be asked to indicate your answers to the following questions about the drug you consumed by marking on the line to indicate how much the adjective or description applies to you. Please indicate how you are feeling right now by using ..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - General
module.preferredDefinition: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - General

question.questionText: Image_line.jpg (line)
Do you FEEL a drug effect right now? (feel_drug_effect_now)
Do you LIKE any of the effects you are feeling right now? (like_effects_you_are_feeling)
Do you DISLIKE any of the effects you are feeling right now? (dislike_effects_you_are_feeling)
Are you HIGH right now? (are_you_high)
Would you like MORE of the drug you took, right now? (like_more_of_the_drug)

protocol.longName: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - General
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Drug Effects Questionnaire (DEQ) consists of simple, face-valid, visual analog scale (VAS) questions on which people report their subjective states after ingesting a substance. The analog scale of responses ranges from "not at all" to "extremely."

form.longName: PhenX PX520303 - Selfreported Craving Specific Heroin
form.preferredDefinition: The Heroin Craving Questionnaire – Short Form 14 (HCQ-SF-14) consists of 14 statements about the respondent's feelings and thoughts about using heroin as he or she is completing the questionnaire (i.e., right now). This instrument allows investigators to obtain a reflection of the respondent's general heroin craving.

headerInstruction.text: Indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with each of the following statements by selecting a number between 1 (STRONGLY DISAGREE) and 7 (STRONGLY AGREE). The closer your selection to one end or the other indicates the strength of your agre..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: 1. Using heroin would not sharpen my concentration. (heroin_not_sharpen_concentration)
2. I could control things better right now if I could use heroin. (control_things_better_heroin)
3. If I tried a little heroin right now, I would not be able to stop using more of it. (unable_to_stop_more_heroin)
4. I want heroin so bad I can almost taste it. (heroin_almost_taste_it)
5. I don't want to use heroin now. (dont_want_heroin_now)
6. I would be less irritable now if I could use heroin. (less_irritable_heroin)
7. All I want to use now is heroin. (want_to_use_heroin)
8. Using heroin would not be very satisfying now. (heroin_would_not_satisfying)
9. I would not enjoy using heroin now. (would_not_enjoy_heroin)
10. I do not need to use heroin now. (do_not_need_heroin_now)
11. I would not be able to control how much heroin I used if I had some here. (unable_control_heroin_amount)
12. I crave heroin right now. (crave_heroin)
13. I have an urge for heroin. (urge_for_heroin)
14. I think that I could resist using heroin now. (could_resist_heroin_now)

Scoring Procedure and Interpretation : Each item is scored on a scale ranging from 1 for "Strongly Disagree" to 7 for "Strongly Agree." The following items are reversescored: 1, 5, 8, 9, 10, and 14 (raw score = 8 minus reversekeyed item score). For total score, sum all 14 items and divide by 14. For the higherorderfactor score, sum all items except item 1 and divide by 13. In a treatmentseeking sample (N = 101), the factor structure of the Heroin Craving QuestionnaireShort Form 14 (HCQSF14) was not consistent with that of the validated 45item HCQ. The higherorderfactor score can be used as a unidimensional assessment of craving it correlates with total score on the 45item HCQ and with visual analog scales for "crave," "want," and "need" (Heinz et al., 2006) (scoring_520303)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Heroin Craving Questionnaire – Short Form 14 (HCQ-SF-14) consists of 14 statements about the respondent's feelings and thoughts about using heroin as he or she is completing the questionnaire (i.e., right now). This instrument allows investigators to obtain a reflection of the respondent's general heroin craving.

form.longName: PhenX PX520102 - Acute Subjective Resp To Substcurrentspecificalcoho
form.preferredDefinition: The Biphasic Alcohol Effects Scale (BAES) is a self-report, unipolar adjective rating scale after consuming alcohol that is designed to measure both stimulant and sedative effects of alcohol.

headerInstruction.text: A baseline assessment of how the person feels may be obtained prior to alcohol administration by using the following instructions: Please rate the extent to which these words describe your feelings at the present time. To measure responses fol..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - Specific - Alcohol
module.preferredDefinition: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - Specific - Alcohol

question.questionText: The following 14 adjectives describe feelings that some people have after drinking alcohol. Please rate the extent to which drinking alcohol has produced these feelings in you at the present time. Select the number that most closely represents your feelings. 0= Not at All 10= Extremely (quesitons_520102)
1. Difficulty concentrating (difficulty_concentrating)
2. Down (down)
3. Elated (elated)
4. Energized (energized)
5. Excited (excited)
6. Heavy head (heavy_head)
7. Inactive (inactive)
8. Sedated (sedated)
9. Slow thoughts (slow_thoughts)
10. Sluggish (sluggish)
11. Stimulated (stimulated)
12. Talkative (talkative)
13. Up (up)
14. Vigorous (vigorous)

Scoring Procedures and Interpretation The Sedation and Stimulation subscales are calculated by summing the following items (for the 14point scale): Stimulation: = BAES3 + BAES4 + BAES5 + BAES11 + BAES12 + BAES13 +BAES14 Sedation: = BAES1 + BAES2 + BAES6 + BAES7 + BAES8 + BAES9 + BAES10. (scoring_520102)

protocol.longName: Acute Subjective Response to Substances - Current - Specific - Alcohol
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Biphasic Alcohol Effects Scale (BAES) is a self-report, unipolar adjective rating scale after consuming alcohol that is designed to measure both stimulant and sedative effects of alcohol.
